intro: Sida rhombifolia f. aristata, commonly known as the aristate sida, is a flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and distinctive bristled tips on its leaves, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal spikes. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Sida rhombifolia f. aristata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
